channel.title: AdvOR likes/features
channel.description:
All
Prior to using Whonix, I used AdvOR and TOR broswer on Windows. Features I like about AdvOR are I can [u][b]dynamically[/b][/u] change:...
[ul][li]number of 'hops' (circuit length)[/li] [li]exit nodes[/li] [li]entry nodes[/li] [li]etc...[/li][/ul]
I don't see setting to change TOR's default [u][b]circuit length[/b][/u] in Arm's list of configuration parameters.
Can anyone point me in right direction?
Thx,

item.title: AdvOR likes/features
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Doesn’t exist for the most part. At least not with good usability.

Exit relays: limited. You can change circuit using arm (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Arm), but it does not guarantee to change the exit relay.

Entry / exit relays: Afaik you can construct your own circuit using Tor’s control protocol and a custom Tor controller. Needs some programming skills. It’s “difficult” (I’d say 4/10 as per scale https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#How_difficult_is_it_to_develop_Whonix.3F).

Circuit length, afaik it’s indeed just a compile time feature. Might be accessible through Tor’s control protocol. Dunno.

etc: See also https://www.torproject.org/docs/tor-manual.html.en.

Read full topic

item.title: AdvOR likes/features
item.dc:creator: mutsuura
item.description:
All

Prior to using Whonix, I used AdvOR and TOR broswer on Windows. Features I like about AdvOR are I can dynamically change:…

[ul][li]number of ‘hops’ (circuit length)[/li]
[li]exit nodes[/li]
[li]entry nodes[/li]
[li]etc…[/li][/ul]

I don’t see setting to change TOR’s default circuit length in Arm’s list of configuration parameters.

Can anyone point me in right direction?

Thx,

Read full topic
